rules.offence: Driving without identification plates or plates not fixed in the prescribed manner.
rules.process: Article 49(1) (h) of the Constitution of Kenya gives an arrested person the right “to be released on bond or bail, on reasonable conditions, pending a charge or trial, unless there are compelling reasons not to be released.” Therefore, one should not be detained since this is not a capital offence.Reasonable bail should be set and if the accused posts the required bail price then he/she should be released pending court appearance. Article 49(2) Constitution of Kenya states; A person shall not be remanded in custody for an offence   if the offence is punishable by a fine only or by imprisonment for not more than six months. Hence one should not be detained for the fore mentioned offence.
